alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lancaster, western Chesterfield and northeastern Kershaw Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Mt Pisgah to 8 miles southwest of Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pageland, Chesterfield, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Mt Pisgah, Jefferson, Ruby, Bethune, Mount Croghan, McFarlan, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, High Point Fire Station, Forty Acre Rock Preserve, Taxahaw, Kershaw Correctional Institution and Central High School. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
